episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the luxurious lives of chickens in Silicon Valley, the notorious Victorian criminal Charles Peace, the ancient Egyptian practice of testing pharaohs' fitness, and the unusual smuggling of pasta across the Sahara Desert.

facts.fact: There are a number of chickens in California that have their own personal chefs.
The Victorian cat burglar, Charles Peace, could supposedly disguise himself just by changing the shape of his face.
If the British treated their monarchy the way that the ancient Egyptians did, Queen Elizabeth II would have to run around a racetrack every three years to prove she was still fit for the job.
People who smuggle drugs one way across the Sahara desert often smuggle pasta the other way.
